content.title: Term Loan Scheme- Credit Line 1 for Minority Community
content.department: Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam
content.details: The scheme 'Term Loan Scheme- Credit Line 1 for Minority Community' is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, loans of up to ₹20,00,000/- are provided at a concessional interest rate to individuals from minority communities to enhance their employability. This applies to those with an annual family income of up to ₹98,000/- in rural areas and ₹1,20,000/- in urban areas. Applicants must be permanent residents of Haryana and belong to minority communities, including Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Parsis, and Jains.
benefits: Loans of up to ₹20,00,000/- at a concessional interest rate to individuals from minority communities to enhance their employability.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 55 years.
The annual family income of the applicant should not exceed ₹98,000/- (Rural Area) and ₹1,20,000/- (Urban Area).
The applicant should belong to a minority community, i.e., Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Parsis, and Jains.
The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).
documents_required: Resident Proof/Address Proof/Ownership Proof i.e. Haryana Domicile Certificate

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Loans of up to ₹20,00,000/- are provided under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the minority communities recognized under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Parsis, and Jains.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants should be between 18 and 55 years of age.

faqs.question: What is the income eligibility criteria for rural areas?
faqs.answer: The annual family income should not exceed ₹98,000/- in rural areas.

faqs.question: What is the income eligibility criteria for urban areas?
faqs.answer: The annual family income should not exceed ₹1,20,000/- in urban areas.

faqs.question: Do applicants need to be permanent residents of Haryana?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must be permanent residents of Haryana.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this loan?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: Can applications be tracked online?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can track their applications through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
